net.corda.core.flows

Interface FlowExternalOperation<R>


  • public FlowExternalOperation<R>

    interface FlowExternalOperation represents an external process that blocks a flow from continuing until the result of FlowExternalOperation.execute has been retrieved. Examples of external processes where interface FlowExternalOperation would be useful include, triggering a long running process on an external system or retrieving information from a service that might be down.

    The flow will suspend while it is blocked to free up a flow worker thread, which allows other flows to continue processing while waiting for the result of this process.

    Implementations of interface FlowExternalOperation should ideally hold references to any external values required by FlowExternalOperation.execute. These references should be passed into the implementation's constructor. For example, an amount or a reference to a Corda Service could be passed in.

    It is discouraged to insert into the node's database from a interface FlowExternalOperation, except for keeping track of deduplicationIds that have been processed. It is possible to interact with the database from inside a interface FlowExternalOperation but, for most operations, is not currently supported.

    See Also:
    interface FlowExternalOperation, FlowExternalOperation.execute, interface FlowExternalOperation, interface FlowExternalOperation, FlowExternalOperation.execute, interface FlowExternalOperation, deduplicationId, interface FlowExternalOperation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      R execute(java.lang.String deduplicationId)
      Executes a blocking operation.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        R execute(java.lang.String deduplicationId)

        Executes a blocking operation.

        The execution of FlowExternalOperation.execute will be run on a thread from the node's external process thread pool when called by FlowLogic.await.

        Parameters:
        deduplicationId - If the flow restarts from a checkpoint (due to node restart, or via a visit to the flow hospital following an error) the execute method might be called more than once by the Corda flow state machine. For each duplicate call, the deduplicationId is guaranteed to be the same allowing duplicate requests to be de-duplicated if necessary inside the execute method.
        See Also:
        FlowExternalOperation.execute, FlowLogic.await
